page.title: 16GURNARD-A VICTORIAN VILLAGE.
page.content:
Gurnard is a Victorian village.These houses were built of brick.Gurnard farm and the old thatched cottage are very much older.They were built of stone.Two small estates,with many bungalows,have been built of imitation stone or brick.One was built on a barley field,the other on a holiday camp site. The new buildings are completely out of character with the rest of the village,both in colour and design.The village is still attractive but there is a litter problem. Gurnard has a strong community spirit, there are many clubs:
Sailing Brownies Women's Institute Fishing Cubs Youth Club Gardening Scouts Sunday School Pony Riding Guides Toddlers Group The Woodvale pub runs many activities.
